page.title: 19Basingstoke Civic Offices
page.content: Councillor Patrick Horrigan was{Mayor of Basingstoke in 1985-86.We met him in{Mayor's Parlour}in the{Civic {Offices}in London Rd.They were opened in 1976.The Town Planning Offices are in the Goldings.The 12 Labour,Tory and independent councillors hold their meetings in the{Council Chamber.}The Mayor was dressed in his red cloak, black hat and gold chain of office.The press,international visitors and the {Mayor's Chaplain},Fr.Cashman of St. Joseph's Church attend meetings.The Mayor showed us the{Queen's signature in the visitor's book and the 2 {maces}.The large one was made in Queen Anne's time,the small one in Charles II's time.They are carried in front of him to show he has authority from the Queen.Basngstokes first Charter was given in 1641. We saw the new one for {Basingstoke and Deane}of 1978.
